definition[0]: to happen after something else and be connected with it
example[0]: The discussion sessions are supposed to follow on from this morning’s lecture.
definition[1]: to go to the same place as someone else at a later time
example[1]: You go ahead – I’ll follow on later.
definition[2]: something that is done or made in addition to something else, or done to continue something that was done before
example[3]: The inspection was a follow-on from the review process.
